div.p: Pious, honorable, and etc. (?) especially gracious lord, my willing service and all good things be with you beforehand.

I would not have written to you if this little letter had not come to me this week from the Bündner (Grisons) with the request that I should send it to you, which I hereby do. Otherwise, I have nothing at all, beyond what I sent to you 8 days ago; I hope everything has been well received by you.
However, it is written from Chur that the rebels have set fire to and burned down the castle of Ramosch belonging to the bishop.

As soon as this news arrived, my lords sent it down to Baden; only tomorrow will the messengers depart. Zurich, Lucerne, Schwyz, and Glarus are to ride to the Bündner (Grisons) in the name of all the Confederates to mediate; may God grant that much will be resolved and all will be well. I know nothing more at this time.
Dated Zurich, 9th of March, in the year 1565.
To the pious, honorable lord Joachim Bäldi, former Landammann (chief magistrate) of Glarus, my gracious, dear lord. Glarus.
